page.title: 14LAW AND ORDER IN WEDMORE
page.content: The average policeman carries a truncheon, keys, handcuffs and a walkie-talkie. In Somerset there are approximately 3 500 people in the police force. The Wedmore area is patrolled by a team of three policemen who are responsible for Wedmore, Cheddar and Axbridge. When an offender is caught he is taken to Bridgwater Police Staion and put in a cell. You have to be 18\ to join the Police Force and 16 to join the cadets. Before you join the force you have to pass a fitness test. The retiring age is 60 and you have 20-30 years in the force. The uniform is now lighter and fire proof.
